uk.ac.susx.mlcl.byblo.measures
Interface Proximity

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractMIProximity, AbstractProximity, Confusion, Cosine, CosineMi, CrMi, Dice, DiceMi, Hindle, Jaccard, JaccardMi, Jensen, KendallTau, Lee, Lin, Lp, Overlap, RecallMi, ReversedProximity, Tanimoto
public interface Proximity

Proximity defines a common interface that all similarity measure must implement. It has been expanded from the usual single method interface, to allow for pre-calculation of values that are independent to one vector.

Author:
Hamish I A Morgan <hamish.morgan@sussex.ac.uk>

          Calculate the similarity of the given vectors Q and R.
 

Method Detail

shared

double shared(uk.ac.susx.mlcl.lib.collect.SparseDoubleVector A,
              uk.ac.susx.mlcl.lib.collect.SparseDoubleVector B)
Calculate the similarity of the given vectors Q and R. If possible this should based entirely upon shared features, while independent features can be pre-calculated using left(SparseDoubleVector) and right(SparseDoubleVector). All three values are combined using combine(double, double, double). If it is not possible to break up the measure in this way, shared should implement the whole measure.

Parameters:
A - the first feature vector
B - the second feature vector
Returns:
portion of similarity measure dependent on both Q and R
